intro: Brassica lativalvis, commonly known as the broad-valved mustard, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or pale yellow, and it produces small, round seeds within its siliqua fruit. Brassica lativalvis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
